parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
